tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: That is why it was revealed on this specially blessed night. Primarily, the Quran was and still is a declaration of Truth
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ad-Dukhan, Ayah 9?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who do not accept the Truth through persuasion expose themselves to the danger of having to accept it under threat of punishment. The subject about which these addressees of the Quran were in doubt was not the existence of God but the oneness of God
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The truth seekers acknowledge it and bow down before it, while those who are enamoured of appearances consider it unimportant and ignore it. But after rejecting the call to accept the Truth, man cannot avoid facing the consequences
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: After prolonged effort on the part of Moses to bring Pharaoh’s people to the right path, by preaching the word of God, his assignment to issue the call for the Truth came to an end
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: In the light of His total knowledge, God looks at the various peoples and then decides to give dominance to those nations whom He finds deserving: those whom He finds undeserving, He dethrones and commits to subjection
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The rise and fall of the Tubba‘ people, a piece of history well-known to the initial addressees of the Quran (the Quraysh), gave proof of the fact that the law of ‘crime and punishment’ was prevalent in this world
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If one ponders over the system of heaven and earth—indeed, of the entire universe, it will become clear that its creation was effected with a definite purpose
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Ad-Dukhan, Ayah 43?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The picture of Hell painted by the Quran here and at other places is sufficient to shake every man who is serious about his future; it will make him rush towards the path of Paradise and away from the path of Hell
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The life there, which is replete with eternal benefits, will be the reward of those who sacrificed the temporary benefits of this world for its sake. The crowning glories of the Hereafter will be savoured only by those who had the courage to risk their worldly success for higher things
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: But its being easy to understand is in direct relation to the desire for guidance. But for one who is not serious or sincere in his search for Truth, the Quran can be impenetrable
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
